title: CAPs-Based Vocabulary Learning Design for Students with High-Incidence Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A blended vocabulary learning program combining face-to-face instruction with online podcasts. Instructors design CAPs (Contextualized Authentic Pedagogical materials) reflecting Mayerâ€™s principles of instructional design and evidence-based vocabulary strategies, while learners engage in discussions and application activities after podcast listening

learning_goals: Learners can define 15 core vocabulary words per week through CAPs with 80% accuracy
Learners can complete writing assignments utilizing vocabulary in authentic contexts based on podcast content with over 70% accuracy
Learners can identify and provide feedback on at least three educational effectiveness elements of CAPs (e.g., visual supports, repetition reinforcement) through peer assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
